citeinfo.origin: National Marine Mammal Laboratory (NMML), Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC), National Marine Fisheries Service, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Estimates of Fish Consumption by Marine Mammals in the Eastern Bering Sea and Aleutian Island Area

abstract.p: In order to improve our understanding of how fisheries and mammals interact in the Bering Sea, the Northwest and Alaska Fisheries Science Center of the National Marine Fisheries Service has been examining some of the relationships between marine mammals and fisheries. A detailed analysis of all eastern Bering Sea and eastern North Pacific pelagic data collected by the United States during research carried out on northern fur seals since 1958 on distribution, reproductive rates and feeding is in progress and initial results have been used in this report.

[Reference: McAlister, W.B. Estimates of Fish Consumption by Marine Mammals in the Eastern Bering Sea and Aleutian Island Area. NMML, NOAA Seattle, WA. 89 p.] This is an unpublished manuscript, available at the NOAA NMML Library.

descript.purpose: Report on fish consumption by marine mammals in the eastern Bering Sea and Aleutian Island area.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
